clusters.abstract: Users are expressing satisfaction with the battery performance of the Action 4 camera, particularly noting its ability to record for 2 hours at 4K resolution without overheating. Comparisons with the previous model, Action 3, suggest that the newer model may have improved in this aspect. There is a clear preference for Action 4 among users, with no reported overheating issues, indicating that battery life and thermal management are strong points for this model.

topK.body: Action4 is what you are looking for bud
topK.author: magenbrot

topK.body: I‚Äôve been loving the Action 4, I get 2 hours from a battery at 4K and no overheating.
topK.author: MyWifeisHigh

topK.body: Not a 100% sure but I think action 3 wasn‚Äôt as bad
topK.author: blo_radar

topK.body: I see and do you know if this overheating also happens with Action 3  or just with 4?
topK.author: Twi2122

topK.body: Action 4. No overheating issues
topK.author: Affectionate-Mud9321

clusters.abstract: User feedback on camera reliability has highlighted concerns and considerations regarding accessory compatibility, particularly between DJI and GoPro products. Customers appreciate the ecosystem of accessories available for GoPro cameras and are interested in similar options for DJI models. The inability to mount DJI cameras on helmets is a specific issue mentioned, suggesting a demand for more versatile mounting solutions. Anticipation for new releases like the DJI Pocket 3 indicates that users are looking for improvements and additional features. Overall, the feedback suggests a need for a broader and more compatible range of accessories to enhance the reliability and versatility of camera usage.

topK.body: If you're not in a hurry hang on a few weeks and see what the DJI Pocket 3 offers
topK.author: ampr1150gs

topK.body: Isn't GoPro accessories are compatible with DJi?
topK.author: Twi2122

topK.body:
Flip a coin.

https://flipsimu.com/
topK.author: Tepppopups

topK.body: That I can't mount on my helmet unfortunately.
topK.author: Twi2122

topK.body: https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1447142-REG/dji_pocketac_osmo_pocket_accessory_mount.html i use this with my pocket 2
topK.author: TrevMoMatic

clusters.abstract: User feedback on action cameras reveals a significant concern regarding software reliability, particularly in GoPro models. Users report frequent SD card corruption and camera freezing, leading to lost footage and diminished user experience. While GoPro offers superior image quality and resolution, the DJI Osmo Action series is praised for its consistent performance and reliability. The DJI Action4, with its 10Bit color and reliable functionality, is highlighted as a strong competitor, especially for users who prioritize camera dependability over the highest image quality. Overall, the choice between GoPro and DJI seems to hinge on the trade-off between advanced features and consistent, reliable operation.

topK.body:
I also went with hero 12. Not to easy to decide. I still believe hero 12 has a better picture quality and stabilization.   
My use cases are mtb and diving.

Both cameras can do snorkeling without case, but for diving you need a case.
topK.author: Flyer2303

topK.body:
If you‚Äôre in EUR, the EUR version of the Action 4 overheats earlier than the Hero 12. 

https://youtu.be/AQpLd5hqvrY?si=IuC4riztme-d4uhe
topK.author: blo_radar

topK.body: I went with the GoPro 12 and the lens max mod 2.0! No complains, no overheating issues. Works great. No regrets :)
topK.author: Prof_Dr_wanna_know

topK.body:
When it comes to reliability OA4 is more reliable than hero 12. 
I got the hero 12 over OA4 because: 
‚Ä¢ 8:7 ratio when you can‚Äôt decide if you want to film for 9:16 or 16:9. 
‚Ä¢ GoPro Log 
‚Ä¢ 5.3k (extra room to crop in) 
I use it mainly for fpv & i‚Äôll tell you the image quality from gopro is really awesome. I‚Äôve watched side by side comparison videos as well, OA4 does better in low light. Hero 12 shoots 27mp raw photos & OA4 shoots 10mp. I also like the presets on hero 12 such as vehicle lights, star trails, etc. hero 12 also shoots in hdr. 
Rn for gopro subscribers the standalone version costs US $300 ($100 off) & with the current promo they‚Äôre giving 32gb sd card & an extra enduro battery.
topK.author: DroneF8

topK.body:
I‚Äôve been a GoPro user since the Hero6‚Ä¶
Up to this date, my favorite was the Hero7, which is the only GoPro I still own.

My biggest problem with the GPs is general is the software reliability. The Hero10 was by far the worst experience ever. The freaking SD card corruption literally destroyed the user experience, and I lost count how many times I lost footage because of that. This got a lil better on the Hero11, but I got this error once.

And not only this, it‚Äôs so frustrating when the quick shot does not work. You press the damn button and the camera does not turn on‚Ä¶ or when it‚Äôs recording and you press to turn off the camera freezes and force you to remove the battery‚Ä¶ most likely corrupting your footage‚Ä¶

All in one, the GP offers a much better ‚Äúcamera‚Äù, with higher resolution, better stability etc‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs pointless if these things are not working properly‚Ä¶ I mean‚Ä¶ the camera is supposed to work flawlessly all the time‚Ä¶ when it fails once it failed its purpose.

After my also bad experience with the Hero11, I got an Action3 and boy what a difference.
Yes the image was not as good as the go pro but I was so damn happy. The camera was working flawlessly. You press to record and boom, it does. You press to stop and it does stop. No corrupted files‚Ä¶ no surprises.

I recently got the Action4, that now offers 10Bit color (I like to grade my footage instead of using the full auto setting) and man image quality is superb. And the best part is that the camera freaking work as it should.
Being honest, I not even considered the Hero12‚Ä¶ 


My summary is:
If you care most about image quality when using the full auto setting‚Ä¶ yes GoPro is the choice.

If you care about reliability and security that your camera will work every time you press the record button, DJI Osmo is the choice.

But know this: if you plan or like to grade your footage, and usually shoot using the pro settings, both cameras will give pretty the same image quality.
topK.author: TierryConstant

clusters.abstract: User feedback indicates concerns about the reliability of camera versions in different regions, particularly with issues such as overheating. There seems to be a perception that the European version of the camera may differ due to stricter EU regulations, which could influence design and performance. Some users speculate that this could lead to different experiences with the product in the US and EU markets. The feedback suggests a need for clarity on the impact of regional regulations on product performance and consistency. Overall, users are expressing a desire for uniform reliability across versions.

topK.body:
According to the video it is because of EU regulations. 

The regulations tend to be stricter in Europe vs USA, so DJI made two different versions of the camera. 

Whereas I guess GoPro just makes one version for both markets and just sticks to the stricter EU regulations even for USA.
topK.author: blo_radar

topK.body: Do you know why is the EUR version different?
topK.author: Twi2122

topK.body: Not 2 Versions of the Camera. You can create a textfile and copy the file to the sd card. The cam overheats like the US Version then. Dont know why its in the EU so fast. Maybe there are too many people burned üòÇüòÇ
topK.author: GamerMatze

clusters.abstract: Community feedback highlights a comparison of editing apps associated with camera brands. DJI provides a free app called Lightcut, while GoPro's Quik app requires payment. Users also mention Davinci Resolve by Blackmagic as a free PC editing option. The DJI Mimo app is noted for its ability to transfer files via USB for faster processing, storing files separately from phone media. The discussion reflects user preferences and experiences with different camera editing software and file management options.

topK.body:
DJI does have its own app, Lightcut.  Lightcut is free.  GoPro app for editing is Quik, not free.
On the PC, I use Davinci Resolve by Blackmagic.  It is free too. 
I don't have a DJI Action x, I have a DJI air2s and gopro11. I would have bought the action 4 if it was out when I bought my gp11 last November.
topK.author: No_Reflection5916

topK.body: Yes, it's called DJI Mimo. You can connect your phone even with a USB cable and do a faster transfer of the files instead of doing it via wifi. It saves the DJI files into a folder separate from your phone photos or videos.
topK.author: nmitrik

topK.body:
Does the DJ have its own editing app?  Can you save videos from it right to your phone files (not forced into photos like go pro ). 

Thnx.
topK.author: Elonmusketeera
